product_name: Philips Norelco Multigroomer All-in-One Trimmer Series 3000, 13 Piece Mens Grooming Kit, for Beard, Face, Nose, and Ear Hair Trimmer and Hair Clipper, NO Blade Oil Needed, MG3750/60
review_header: What you need to know, 9 paragraphs of advice
review_text: 1. Booklet writes it takes 8 hrs to charge and 60 minutes of usage. (That is why I like battery powered trimmers, just have an extra set when it dies. I don't have to wait until it recharges.) There is a emergency charge time, that will give you 5 minutes of usage.2. Read the pamphlet. It has important information about charging and usage.3. I have a beard. I saw the video with the person with a beard that said he cuts his beard with the 12mm guard. I used the 9mm guard, and I wouldn't use a guard shorter than this.  My wife said any shorter, and it wouldn't be called a beard. She didn't want it shorter. I trim my beard once every 2 weeks. I recommend one should start  with the 16mm guard and work your way down.I plan to use the 16mm guard the next time. I used the 5mm guard for the mustache.4. To take off the blade. You hold it from the top and pushed upwards and towards the back of blade. The bottom part of the blade is attached to the shaver handle. It is a plastic fitting, so be careful. Lift off the top part which is the blade, then you can remove the attachment from the shaver handle.5. I am concerned that the plastic guards might break while attaching them, and again when removing them.6. The mini precise blade, is very convenient.7. The nose blade is not sufficient in removing noticeable hairs. You might need to use the mini blade.8. I have the guard attachments and nose blade in a zip lock bag. The shaver with a 16mm guard, 5 mm guard, and the mini blade are in a second zip lock bag. Then I put them into the bag that came with the beard trimmer. This way there won't be hair laying around in the drawers.9. The number for the guard size is on the outside of the guard, below the guard blades. The numbers on the inside, I presume are the parts number. It isn't easy to read the guard size number, since it is molded into the guard. I had to turn it in an angle that the light would reflect onto the number.

product_name: Philips Norelco Multigroomer All-in-One Trimmer Series 3000, 13 Piece Mens Grooming Kit, for Beard, Face, Nose, and Ear Hair Trimmer and Hair Clipper, NO Blade Oil Needed, MG3750/60
review_header: Affordable, Versatile, and Reliable Grooming Solution
review_text: Affordable, Versatile, and Reliable Grooming Solution!After using the Philips Norelco Multi Groomer Series 3000, I can confidently say it‚Äôs one of the best grooming kits in its price range. It offers a wide range of attachments for various grooming needs while being easy to use and maintain. Here‚Äôs my in-depth review:1. Build Quality and DesignThe trimmer has a sleek and lightweight design, making it comfortable to hold and maneuver during grooming. The build quality feels solid, especially for the price. The attachments fit securely onto the trimmer, and swapping them out is quick and easy.2. Versatility with AttachmentsThis kit comes with 13 attachments designed to handle every grooming task:Beard and Face: The precision trimmer and various guards allow for easy shaping, trimming, and detailing. I‚Äôve been able to maintain a clean, sharp beard line without hassle.Nose and Ear Hair: The dedicated nose and ear trimmer works well and doesn‚Äôt pull or tug on hair, which is a big plus.Hair Clipping: The hair clipper guards are great for touch-ups and trimming short hairstyles. It won‚Äôt replace a full-size clipper for heavy-duty haircuts but is perfect for maintenance.The variety of guards ensures you can achieve the exact length and style you‚Äôre going for. Whether you‚Äôre looking for a close trim or something longer, this kit has you covered.3. PerformanceThe trimmer is powered by DualCut technology, which ensures a fast and precise trim. The blades are self-sharpening and stay effective even after months of use. I‚Äôve noticed consistent performance every time, and it doesn‚Äôt struggle with thicker hair.What I love most is how quiet the motor is compared to other trimmers I‚Äôve used. It feels smooth and doesn‚Äôt overheat during use.4. Maintenance-Free BladesOne of the standout features of this trimmer is that it doesn‚Äôt require blade oiling. This makes maintenance effortless. A quick rinse of the attachments under water after use is all you need to keep them clean.5. Battery LifeThe trimmer boasts an impressive 60 minutes of cordless use after a full charge, which is more than enough for multiple grooming sessions. Charging it takes about 8 hours, so I usually leave it plugged in overnight. For the price, the battery performance is excellent.6. Portability with Travel PouchThis trimmer is compact and lightweight, and the included travel pouch is a fantastic addition. It keeps the trimmer and all the attachments organized, making it easy to carry everything for trips. The dual voltage capability is also perfect for international travel.7. Value for MoneyFor the price, this grooming kit delivers exceptional value. You‚Äôre getting a reliable, all-in-one solution that works for various grooming needs without breaking the bank.Things to Consider:The long charge time (8 hours) might be a drawback for some, but the 60-minute runtime more than makes up for it.It‚Äôs not designed for heavy-duty haircuts, so if you‚Äôre looking for a professional-grade clipper for thick hair, you might need something more powerful.Final VerdictThe Philips Norelco Multi Groomer Series 3000 is an excellent choice for anyone looking for an affordable and versatile grooming kit. It‚Äôs perfect for maintaining your beard, trimming body hair, and handling those pesky nose and ear hairs. The travel pouch and low-maintenance design (no blade oil needed!) make it an even better option for frequent travelers.If you‚Äôre in the market for a reliable, all-in-one grooming solution that won‚Äôt break the bank, this is the trimmer to get. Highly recommended!

product_name: Renogy 1000W Pure Sine Wave Inverter with ECO Mode, 12V DC to AC 120V 110V Converter for Off-Grid Solar System, Home, RV, Solar Power Inverter with Remote Switch, Surge 2000W
review_header: Worked OK until it didn't - then it was a fire hazard
review_text: I purchased this to add a reliable pure sine inverter to my setup.  It was replacing an old 900w Cobra (non sine) inverter which has served me well for about 8 years.  I was excited as I would be able to run my PC from this unit.Setup was easy, no issues with install.  The unit had some heft and looked of top-notch build quality.I did notice that the ECO feature didn't always work, it would occasionally fault with a 120w restart load.  This would require me to go into the cabinet and manually flick the switch off and on.  I eventually just kept it set to the ON mode rather than having it fail intermittently and beeping at me.  Just a mild annoyance that the ECO mode didn't work as advertised, which is why I bought this model rather than the Non-ECO version.  I have enough solar to not worry about the small load the inverter itself took...  So not a deal-breakerI ran this for a month with no issues (beside the previously mentioned ECO faults), never pulling more than 250w max (outside of initial setup testing which I pulled 800w for 2 minutes)  Normal workload was between 30-120w constant (24/7).  So, a rather light work load.  I went with this model in case we have an extended power outage from a storm (I'm in central Florida).  In an emergency it would power a window AC and the kitchen fridge.As luck would have it I was sitting in my office (72F ambient) where it was housed and heard the fans kicking on a bit more than usual.  After about 10 minutes of this I heard a loud POP and the inverter started belching smoke.  It kept running and did not blow the fuse in or out.  I quickly turned it off.  The well ventilated cabinet my solar electrics are housed in was 80F at the time of failure (the inverter is the only heat source in there).This really bothers me.  Whatever safety features are built-in did not work.  I do not work from home and had I not been sitting there as it happened I have no doubt that this would have caused a fire.I use several Renogy panels and a Rover 40li charge controller.  They have worked like a champ - no issues.  Because of this I bought the inverter and the Bluetooth monitor for it.  I thought I was paying a premium for the reliability, however this seems not to be the case.If you own this model, please be careful.  If you are considering buying it, take what you will from my review.  This will be the last Renogy product I purchase.

product_name: Renogy 1000W Pure Sine Wave Inverter with ECO Mode, 12V DC to AC 120V 110V Converter for Off-Grid Solar System, Home, RV, Solar Power Inverter with Remote Switch, Surge 2000W
review_header: Worked for three and a half months
review_text: I bought the first one in April 2024, the cable for the remote panel didn't hold in the outlet which was critical for my case. I returned the unit and Amazon sent a replacement, with no issues. This one worked with a very light load for three and a half months in my travel trailer. Now I can smell burnt electronics from inside, the unit doesn't power on. I will update the review after settling the warranty claim.

review_text: Der Mini-Ofen ist eigentlich ein vollwertiger Ofen f√ºr Backbleche in Standardgr√∂√üe.Fertige Backpapierabschnitte passen ohne Beschnitt.Der Ofen ben√∂tigt eine Aufheizzeit, wie ein nomaler Einbauherd. Das geht zwar auch mit dem ICON 70 Liter, nur sollte man dazu mindestens zw√∂lf Minuten veranschlagen, statt nur acht.Die rote Kontrolllampe erlischt bei erreichter Temperatur. Bis 200 ¬∞C erreicht sind, dauert das mehr als 10 Minuten. (Kleingeb√§ck lege ich schon in den kalten Ofen, um Energie zu sparen.)Das Wahlrad f√ºr Oberhitze, Unterhitze und Hei√üluft hat zus√§tzlich auch eine AUS Position. Der kleine 0/1 Schalter vorne unten rechts am Ger√§t ist kein Stromschalter, sondern nur zum Ein- und Ausschalten des Drehspie√ües.Der Drehspie√ü hat reichlich L√§nge, weil er diagonal im Ofen eingeh√§ngt wird. Die Spitze kommt in eine √ñffnung hinten rechts im Backraum und das Ende wird in eine Blechhalterung vorne links im Backraum eingeh√§ngt. So passt mehr auf einen Spie√ü.Die 40¬∞C Joghurt Funktion ist nicht nur f√ºr Joghurt praktisch, sondern auch f√ºr Hefeteig, der vor dem Backen noch mal gehen soll.Die 80 ¬∞C Reinigungsfunktion musste ich noch nicht benutzen. Es wurde kaum der Backraum dreckig, obwohl ich den Ofen t√§glich benutzte. (Br√∂tchen, selbst gemachte Blechpizza)Positiv, dass man die Backofenlampe einfach austauschen kann, falls defekt. Ein Glask√∂rper zum Abschrauben ist direkt im Backraum zug√§nglich.(Problem: Das mehrsprachige, auch deutsche Handbuch erwartet ein Backofen-Leuchtmittel 230 V Typ G9 mit 15 Watt. Bestellen kann ich bei Amazon nur Leuchtmittel dieses Typs mit 25 Watt. Hoffentlich ersetzbar, wenn mal ein Birnen-Tausch f√§llig wird.)Der separate Haltegriff f√ºr hei√üe Backbleche ist etwas wackelig beim Gebrauch, aber benutzbar.Ich bin mit dem Ofen zufrieden.Unentschieden bin ich nur in der Frage zur Haltbarkeit. product_name: bett1 Bodyguard Anti-Kartell-Matratze | Testsieger Stiftung Warentest: Note 1,6 (Test 2/2024, mittelfest & Fester, 90x200 cm, 2in1 H√§rtegrade, Bezug waschbar bis 60 Grad, Oeko-TEX 100, QXSchaum)
review_text: Vorwort:Meine alte Matratze von Dunlopillo bekam nach 6 Monaten starke Kuhlen, so dass ich kaum noch schlafen konnte.Habe ich etwas falsch gemacht? Ich w√ºrde sagen nein, denn ich hatte ein gutes federndes 7-Zonen-Lattenrost, dazu die Matratze auch oft gewendet und nicht st√§rker als der H√§rtegrad war belastet.Alleine der Gedanke ans schlafen machte mich fertig.Doch dann hatte ich viele Berichte √ºber die Bodyguard Matratze gesehen und durchgelesen.So berichteten viele fast nur positives von der Matratze, egal ob Stiftung Warentest, ein Bericht im Fernsehen, ein Youtube Video und die (Amazon)Bewertungen.Die Hoffnung stirbt ja bekanntlich zuletzt, also habe ich die Matratze bei Amazon bestellt.Bestellung:Am 15.11 bestellte ich die Matratze in 90x200 cm, mir wurde eine Lieferzeit von 2-3 Wochen angezeigt. Vermutlich weil sich wirklich sehr viele K√§ufer √ºber die lange Lieferzeit beschwerten.Geliefert werden sollte sie jedenfalls zwischen  10 - 17. Dezember.Schon am 18.11 bekam ich allerdings die Versandmitteilung per E-Mail.Eine Sendungsverfolgung war auch dabei, versand wurde die Matratze √ºbrigens mittels DPD.Die Paketma√üe betragen 120 cm x 40 cm x 40 cm laut E-Mail.Angekommen ist die Matratze dann am 22.11, sprich nach 4 Werktagen war sie schon bei mir.Toll!Lattenrost:Ich benutze f√ºr die Bodyguard Matratze ein selbstgebautes Lattenrost, wie z.B. von Stiftung Warentest (Anleitung zum Lattenrostbau) empfohlen.Mit einem "normalen" 7-Zonen-Lattenrost, wie man es fast √ºberall bekommt, k√∂nnte die Federung zu stark sein.Im Baumarkt um die Ecke bekommt man jedenfalls die Teile f√ºr den Selbstbau-Lattenrost schon f√ºr 40 - 60 Euro.Bezug:Ich finde den Bezug richtig gut. Die Rezensionen machten mir aber sorgen, doch der Bezug macht einen stabilen Eindruck, ist dick genug und sehr Luftdurchl√§ssig.Das merkt man schon, wenn man mit der Handfl√§che auf die Matratze dr√ºckt, dann sp√ºrt man einen starken Luftzug um die Hand.Ich bin wirklich auf den Sommer gespannt.Der Bezug macht jedenfalls einen guten Eindruck, ich habe bisher nichts zu bem√§ngeln.H√§rtegrad3(grau/blau, dunkel):Auf dieser Seite habe ich bisher nur geschlafen, da ich diese Seite als hart genug betrachte.H√§rtegrad4(wei√ü, hell):Mein erster Eindruck war, wow ziemlich hart, geschlafen habe ich hier erstmal noch nicht.Schlafkomfort:Die Matratze ist anfangs ziemlich hart.Ansonsten muss ich sagen, die angeblichen sp√ºrbaren Rillen (laut anderen Rez.) merke ich garnicht, totaler Unsinn meiner Meinung nach.Zum Thema W√§rme kann ich noch nicht so viel sagen, w√§rmer ist das Schlafen jedenfalls nicht geworden, was ja viele behauptet haben.Ich vermute das h√§ngt auch mit dem Bettbezug zusammen, ich nutze ein ganz normales Spannbetttuch.Die erste(n) Nacht(/N√§chte):Es war ungewohnt, auf so einer harten und ebenen Matratze zu schlafen.Die erste Nacht und auch die zweite waren ertr√§glich...Doch die dritte Nacht war eine qual, ich bin mit R√ºckenschmerzen aufgewacht und hatte mich die Nacht √ºber immer hin und her gew√§lzt.Ich muss dazu sagen, ich bin Nachts R√ºcken- und Seitenschl√§fer, tags√ºber nur Bauchschl√§fer, man soll ja Tags√ºber nicht wirklich so lange schlafen.Anfangs schlafe ich sehr gerne auf der Seite und dann auf den R√ºcken, nachts drehe ich mich jedoch sehr gerne wieder auf die Seite.Scheinbar ist die Matratze f√ºr den Seitenschlaf anfangs noch zu hart.Nach einer Woche:Nach einer Woche hat es sich merklich gebessert. Ich war am Wochenende morgens aufgewacht undstehe normalerweise sofort auf, weil die alte Matratze eben viel zu weich war und ich nicht mehr liegen konnte.Doch an jenem Samstag nach fast einer Woche mit der BG Matratze, war ich liegen geblieben! Ich hoffe wirklich sehr, dass die Matratze so bleibt und h√§lt was der Hersteller verspricht!Meine HWS Probleme sind schw√§cher geworden, doch noch habe ich die Matratze nicht lange, daher muss man sehen wie es die n√§chsten Wochen und vorallem Monate so wird.Ich wollte auch noch erw√§hnen, ich bewege mich sehr viel am Tag, was den R√ºcken gut tut und ich empfehle jeden das auch zu tun!Bewegung ist sehr wichtig f√ºr den R√ºcken, auch die Arme beim Laufen mit zu schaukeln.Nach √ºber einem Monat:Etwas weicher geworden und dadurch keine verspannten Schultern mehr!Ich sinke jetzt auf der Seite und auf dem R√ºcken liegend mehr ein, was den Schultern zugute kommt.Nach 3 Monaten:Ich w√ºrde mir glatt noch eine kaufen, h√§tte ich den Platz, bis jetzt ist sie super!Nach √ºber 1 Jahr:Das UPDATE kommt ende 2017, aber es deutet alles darauf hin, dass sich nichts √§ndern wird.Ich schlafe bestens auf dieser Matratze, dank neuem Kissen auch ohne Nackenprobleme.Der R√ºcken war noch nie so dankbar, ich hoffe das bleibt so!Geruch:Ich hatte mich schon auf einen bestialischen Geruch eingestellt.Ja, die Matratze roch schon etwas(!), aber nur, wenn man direkt an diese rangeht und schnuppert.Wenn man genau dar√ºber nachdenkt stellt man fest, es ist einfach nur ein Schaumstoff-Geruch.Mich erinnert diese Situation an ein neues Buch oder Auto, diese haben Produkttechnisch ja auch einen Eigengeruch bzw. Der Hersteller hat im Beipackzettel vermerkt, dass sich der Geruch nach sp√§testens 14 Tagen gelegt haben sollte. Das kann ich leider so nicht best√§tigen. Es m√ºffelt immer noch nach Chemie, und das ist kein wirklich sch√∂ner Geruch.Viele Rezensenten berichten, sie h√§tten keinen oder nur einen allenfalls kurzen Geruch wahrgenommen. Hier frage ich mich wirklich, wie authentisch solche Berichte sind.Mich erinnert das an eine bekannte Nackenst√ºtzkopfkissen-Firma, die vor 20 Jahren ihre Kissen ebenfalls so auslieferten, dass diese erstmal f√ºr 3 Wochen in den Keller zum Ausl√ºften verbannt werden mussten, ehe diese wunderbaren Kissen, die ich bis heute x-mal nachbestellt habe, ihren komfortablen Zweck erf√ºllten.Diese Firma hat aber in den Jahren den Gestank beim Produkt immer weiter reduziert bzw die Kissen schon so lange vorher vom Werk aus ausl√ºften lassen, dass sie heute praktisch vom ersten Tag an nutzbar sind. Ich w√ºrde dem Hersteller anraten, die Matratzen lange genug von Werk aus auszul√ºften,  soweit das Material danach noch eine Kompression zwecks Auslieferung aush√§lt.Preis-Leistungs-Verh√§ltnis: Der Preis von 199,- Euro ist okay, soweit die Matratze einige Jahre durchh√§lt.Kaufempfehlung: Ja, aber es sollte klar sein, dass die Matratze einige Wochen Zeit zum ausl√ºften ben√∂tigt.Wegen des extremen Geruchsbildes, das die Nutzqualit√§t in den ersten Wochen erheblich einschr√§nkt, halte ich  3 von 5 m√∂glichen Sternen f√ºr angemessen.

product_name: bett1 Bodyguard Anti-Kartell-Matratze | Testsieger Stiftung Warentest: Note 1,6 (Test 2/2024, mittelfest & Fester, 90x200 cm, 2in1 H√§rtegrade, Bezug waschbar bis 60 Grad, Oeko-TEX 100, QXSchaum)
review_header: Bodyguard-Matratze H3/H4!? - Guter Schlafkomfort zu gutem Preis
review_text: Vorwort: Ich bin weder professioneller Matratzentester, noch wurde ich f√ºr die nachfolgende Rezension bezahlt. Ich bin schlichtweg ein Otto-Normal-Verbraucher, der hier seine gesammelten Erfahrungen anderen Usern zu Verf√ºgung stellen m√∂chte. Zitate wurden der Gebrauchsanweisung und Garantie des Herstellers bett1.de entnommen und sind gesondert gekennzeichnet.Verwendetes Equipment: 2 Testpersonen (175 cm, ca. 71 kg; 165; ca. 65 kg), Bett 2m x 2m, verstellbarer Zonen- Lattenrost (alles auf hart eingestellt), handels√ºbliche Bettdecken (1x Sommerbettdecke, 1x 4-Jahres-Bettdecke Ma√üe 155 x 220), 3x handels√ºbliche Kopfkissen, Spannbetttuch 2m x 2m (nachfolgend auch als Bettlaken bezeichnet)Was wurde bestellt?Es wurden zwei Matratzen mittelfest (H3/H4) in der Gr√∂√üe 100 x 200 cm am Sonntag, 22.01.2017 bestellt.Testergebnis Stiftung Warentest und andere:Laut der Gebrauchsanweisung des Herstellers wurde ‚Äûam 22.05.2015 das Modell Bodyguard Mittelfest (H3) in der Gr√∂√üe 90 x 200 als ‚Äûbeste je getestete Matratze‚Äú‚Äú (Zitat Gebrauchsanweisung und Garantie Bett1.de, Seite 1) getestet. Hierbei wurde lediglich die Liegeseite H3 der Bodyguard Mittelfest getestet. Die Liegeseite H4 wurde von unabh√§ngigen Ergonomie Instituten getestet. Diese ‚Äûbest√§tigen die korrekte Liegeh√§rte H4 der festen Liegeseite und zus√§tzlich die guten ergonomischen Liegeeigenschaften f√ºr die g√§ngigsten vier K√∂rperformen in Seiten-und R√ºckenlage.‚Äú (Zitat Gebrauchsanweisung und Garantie Bett1.de, Seite 2)Lieferung:Die Matratzen wurden am Sonntag bei Bett1 √ºber Amazon bestellt. Die Lieferzeit wurde mit 14 bis 17 Tagen angegeben. Dienstags erhielten wir die Nachricht, dass die Matratzen versandt wurden. Am Donnerstag, 26.01.2017, wurden die Matratzen schlie√ülich durch DPD geliefert. Also gemessen an der avisierten Lieferzeit recht flott!Verpackung:Die Matratzen sind jeweils in einem Karton (ca. 37cm x 37cm x 120 cm) verpackt. Das Gewicht eines Kartons betr√§gt laut Adressaufkleber 15,9 kg. Besch√§digungen an den Kartons wurden nicht festgestellt. In dem Karton befindet sich die in Folie eingerollte, vakuumierte Matratze. Bevor die Matratze ausgerollt wurde, stellte ich  fest, dass die Folie am Ende schon leicht aufgerissen war und die Matratze ‚Äûherausquoll‚Äú. Dies war im √úbrigen bei der zweiten bestellten Matratze auch der Fall. Eine Besch√§digung an den Matratzen wurde jedoch nicht festgestellt. Nachdem die Matratze ausgerollt wurde, zog diese auch schon durch den Riss in der Verpackung Luft. Durch diesen Umstand machte ich mich schnell daran, die Matratze aus der Folie zu holen, ohne die Folie unn√∂tig zu besch√§digen.Die Folie wird f√ºr eine m√∂gliche R√ºcksendung ben√∂tigt ‚Äì zumindest wurde dies in einigen Rezensionen geschrieben. Diese Aussage ist nur bedingt richtig. Der Matratze liegt eine Gebrauchsanweisung/ Garantie bei. Neben den Pflegehinweisen geht aus der Gebrauchsanweisung zu diesem Thema folgendes hervor: ‚ÄûWir bitten Sie, die Verpackungsfolie unbedingt aufzubewahren. Im Falle einer R√ºcksendung verpacken Sie bitte Ihre Matratze erneut mit dieser Folie. ‚Ä¶ Sollten Sie die Verpackungsfolie entsorgt haben, bitten wir Sie eine neue Verpackungsfolie zu besorgen und ihre Matratze vor der Abholung zu verpacken.‚Äú (Zitat Gebrauchsanweisung und Garantie Bett1.de, Seite 6) Alternativ kann man sich von Bett1 eine Folie zum Unkostenbeitrag von 49 ‚Ç¨ liefern lassen.Hintergrund hierzu sind die Hygienebestimmungen der Speditionen, wonach die Spediteure in keinen Hautkontakt mit unhygienischen Produkten kommen sollen.Geruch:Auf Grund von verschiedenen Rezensionen, in denen sich √ºber unangenehme Ger√ºche beklagt wurde, wurden die Matratzen direkt nach dem Auspacken am Donnerstag, 26.01.2017, mit der Nase unter die Lupe genommen.Man musste sehr nah an die Matratzen heran, um den Eigengeruch der Matratzen festzustellen. Zun√§chst dachte ich, dass die Matratzen parf√ºmiert worden seien. Erst nach einigen Sekunden stellte sich ein chemischer Geruch ein.Da die Matratzen sich erst einmal vom vakuumierten Zustand erholen sollten, lie√ü ich die Matratzen in einem Kellerraum liegen.Nach dem Auspacken kann die Matratze im √úbrigen schon nach ca. 8 Minuten zum Schlafen genutzt werden. Dies geht jedenfalls aus einer Information hervor, die auf dem Karton gedruckt ist. In der Gebrauchsanweisung findet man hierzu jedoch nichts.Nach ca. 15 Minuten nahm ich die Matratzen noch einmal in Augenschein. Der Raum war mit dem chemischen Matratzengeruch erf√ºllt, so dass ich mich entschloss erst einmal das Fenster zu √∂ffnen.Nach ca. 2 Stunden schloss ich das Fenster wieder und √ºberlie√ü die Matratzen ihrem Schicksal.Ca. 23 Stunden (am 27.01.2017) sp√§ter beschloss ich die Matratzen zu ihrem zuk√ºnftigen Bestimmungsort (dem Bett) zu verbringen. Der Geruch im Raum war immer noch nicht verflogen und vergleichbar intensiv wie am Vortag.Da der Geruch laut Hersteller, Hohenstein Institut (Oeko-Tex Standard 100) und Stiftung Warentest gesundheitlich unbedenklich ist, wurden die Matratzen zum Bett gebracht. Als Liegefl√§che wurde in beiden F√§llen die H3-Seite verwendet.Den H√§rtegrad H3 der Matratze kann durch einen Aufkleber auf der entsprechenden Matratzenseite ausmachen. Da der Aufkleber nat√ºrlich entfernt werden sollte, kann man den H√§rtegrad auch anhand des Matratzenk√∂rpers bestimmen.  Der Matratzenbezug muss hierzu ge√∂ffnet werden: Die H3-Seite ist grau; die H4-Seite wei√ü.Das Bett wurde mit neuer Bettw√§sche bezogen und wartet nun mehr auf seine Nutzer. Die Matratzen sind hierbei durch die Kopfkissen und die Bettdecken bedeckt; lediglich die R√§nder der Matratzen liegen frei. Die Fenster sind geschlossen; die T√ºre steht auf.Nach ca. 2 ¬Ω Stunden wurde das Schlafzimmer inspiziert. Beim Betreten des Schlafzimmers wurde kein st√∂render Geruch festgestellt. Den Matratzengeruch stellte ich lediglich fest, als ich meine Nase auf das Bettlaken dr√ºckte. Diesen stufe ich als gering ein.√Ñnderung des Versuchsaufbaus: Fenster geschlossen; T√ºre offen; Bettdecken auf ein Drittel zur√ºckgeschlagen, so dass ein Matratzenbereich (inkl. Bettlaken) von ca. 70 cm x 200 cm freiliegt.Bei der √Ñnderung wurde feststellt, dass die auf der Matratzen aufliegende Seite der Bettdecke den Geruch der Matratze angenommen hat. Auch hier ist der Geruch als minimal zu bezeichnen. Die au√üenliegende Seite der Bettdecke weist diesen Geruch bislang nicht auf.Um die Testergebnisse nicht zu verf√§lschen, wurde meine Frau, die ca. 2 Stunden unterwegs war, zu dem Versuchsaufbau gef√ºhrt. Einen Geruch innerhalb des Schlafzimmers wurde nicht festgestellt. Durch das bew√§hrte Pr√ºfverfahren Nase auf die Matratze bzw. das Bettlaken, wurde ein Geruch festgestellt. Dieser wurde als minimal bezeichnet.Ca. 3 Stunden vor dem Schlafengehen wurde das Zimmer noch einmal sto√ügel√ºftet, aber nicht auf Grund von Geruchs-Ausd√ºnstungen der neuen Matratzen. Nur bei dem Pr√ºfverfahren ‚ÄûNase auf Matratze‚Äú wurde ein minimaler Geruch festgestellt.In der ersten Nacht (bei gekippten Fenster) wurden auch keine Ger√ºche festgestellt.Meine Frau mutma√üt, dass man vielleicht bei der Produktion auf Grund der Kritiken etwas ver√§ndert hat. Der Hersteller Bett1 hierzu: ‚ÄûWir haben desweiteren den Zeitraum der Ausd√ºnstungen aller Bodyguard-Matratzen um zus√§tzliche  drei Tage verl√§ngert.‚Äú (Zitat Gebrauchsanweisung und Garantie Bett1.de, Seite 6)Die Kopfkissen und die Bettdecken wurden nach der ersten Nacht von den Matratzen heruntergenommen. Die Matratzen sind lediglich mit dem Bettlaken bezogen. Wie jeden Morgen wurde eine Sto√ül√ºftung von ca. 15 Minuten durchgef√ºhrt.Ca. 4 Stunden sp√§ter wurde eine Kontrolle in dem Schlafzimmer durchgef√ºhrt. Die Zimmert√ºre ist ge√∂ffnet, die Fenster geschlossen. Ger√ºche (insbesondere Ausd√ºnstungen der Matratzen) wurden nicht festgestellt. Lediglich beim Nase-auf-Matratze-Test wurde ein minimaler Eigengeruch der Matratzen festgestellt und hierbei musste die Nase schon immens auf die Matratze gedr√ºckt werden, um √ºberhaupt etwas feststellen zu k√∂nnen.Kopfkissen und Bettdecken wurden seit dem Kauf tags√ºber am Matratzenende deponiert, so dass ca. ¬æ der Matratzenfl√§che frei sind. Lediglich das Laken wurde auf den Matratzen komplett belassen.Am 10.02.2017 wurde ein erneuter Geruchstest durchgef√ºhrt: Die Matratzen weisen nur noch eine marginalen Eigengeruch auf.Ein weiterer Geruchstest wurde am 17.02.2017, also drei Wochen nach Lieferung, durchgef√ºhrt: Die Matratzen weisen so gut wie keinen Eigengeruch mehr auf. Man muss sich schon sehr anstrengen, um √ºberhaupt noch was festzustellen.Liegekomfort:Schon beim Transport der Matratzen vom Keller zum Schlafzimmer wurde ein immenser Unterschied zu den 13 Jahre alten Kaltschaum Matratzen festgestellt. W√§hrend die neuen Matratzen eher sperriger Natur waren, wabbelten die alten Matratzen nur so herum.Die neuen Bodyguard-Matratzen weisen eine H√∂he (Dicke) von ca. 17,5 cm auf, w√§hrend die alten Matratzen lediglich mit einer H√∂he (Dicke) von ca. 12 cm aufwarten k√∂nnen. Um verl√§ssliche Werte zu bekommen, wurden die Matratzen ohne Matratzenbezug am Kopf-/ Fu√üende vermessen.Die Matratzen sind deutlich h√§rter als die alten Matratzen, wobei der H√§rtegrad dieser nicht mehr beziffert werden kann. (Wenn ich den H√§rtegrad jetzt beziffern m√ºsste, w√ºrde ich ihn bei H1 ansiedeln.) Den Umstand f√ºhre ich aber auch auf das hohe Alter der Matratzen zur√ºck.Die Erfahrungen der Testpersonen w√§hrend der 1. Nacht auf den Matratzen waren unterschiedlich. W√§hrend die Probandin kaum ein Auge zu gemacht hat, wurde der Proband immer wieder wach. Dies f√ºhrt der Proband darauf zur√ºck, dass die Probandin dauernd mit ihrem Mobiltelefon zu Gange war. (Merke: In der kommenden Nacht wird das elektronische Hilfsmittel zur √úberbr√ºckung der Nacht aus dem Schlafzimmer verbannt, um verl√§ssliche Schlafwerte zu erhalten!!!)Beide Probanden teilten jedoch die Erkenntnis, dass die Matratzen einen hohen Liegekomfort aufweisen.Lediglich der Proband stellt nach der Nacht einen leichten Kopfschmerz fest. Der Proband f√ºhrt dies jedoch auf den hohen Weinkonsum des Vorabends zur√ºck. (Merke: Proband bekommt keinen Alkohol mehr, um verl√§ssliche Werte zu erhalten!!!)Die zweite Nacht auf den Matratzen ist nun mehr absolviert. Die Probandin hat durchgeschlafen; das Schlaferlebnis wurde als gut bezeichnet. Der Proband stellte nach dem Aufwachen keine Kopfschmerzen fest und bewertet das Schlaferlebnis ebenfalls mit gut.Update 22.02.2017: Der Schlafkomfort ist nach wie vor gut. Sowohl bei der Probandin als auch beim Probanden wurden keinerlei Beschwerden festgestellt. Anfangs war das Liegen auf den neuen Matratzen noch recht ungewohnt, aber nicht unangenehm. Inzwischen haben wir uns an die neuen Matratzen gew√∂hnt und bereuen den Kauf nicht.H√§rtegrad:Ich habe mich im Vorfeld lange mit den H√§rtegraden der Matratzen auseinandergesetzt. Ein H√§rtegradrechner teilte mir mit, dass f√ºr mich der optimale H√§rtegrad H2 sei. Ich habe lange √ºberlegt, ob ich direkt die weichere Bodyguard-Matratze bestellen soll. Aber ich habe mich dagegen entschieden: Ich hatte gelesen, dass die mittelfeste H3-Matratze f√ºr die vier g√§ngigsten K√∂rperformen (kleine, leichte Frau; kleine birnenf√∂rmige Frau; gro√üer, schwerer Mann; gro√üer, schrankf√∂rmiger Mann) eine gute Liegeeigenschaft bietet. Und irgendwo finde ich mich ja zwischen  den o. g. K√∂rperformen  auch wieder. Also warum sollte ich dann nicht erst einmal diesen H√§rtegrad ausprobieren.Fazit:Letzten Endes muss jeder selbst entscheiden, ob die Matratze mit dem jeweiligen H√§rtegrad etwas f√ºr ihn ist oder nicht. Ein Probeliegen im M√∂belladen reicht meiner Meinung nach nicht aus, um verl√§sslich etwas zum Komfort, H√§rtegrad etc. sagen zu k√∂nnen. Aus diesem Grund finde ich das Konzept mit dem 100-t√§gigen Testzeitraum auch eine gute Idee vom Hersteller.Wir haben die Matratzen nun mehr fast Wochen getestet und sind sehr zufrieden:Der anf√§ngliche Eigengeruch der Matratzen ist recht schnell verflogen und hat den Schlaf nicht negativ beeinflusst.Die Matratzenh√§rte (im Vergleich zu den alten Matratzen) erforderte schon etwas Eingew√∂hnung, aber auch hier wurde der Schlaf nicht negativ beeinflusst.Der Liegekomfort wird als gut bis sehr gut beziffert.Alles in allem gibt es 5 Sterne.

review_text: this is the second one I have purchased to use as backup computers and was skeptical to buy refurbished machines, however, they have both been great and definitely worth the money. For this price I could afford to put one downstairs to use only for my craft purposes which is nice to have one designated for that use, even though it does everything else as well.
variant_name: Style: i7-6700 3.40Ghz, Size: 32GB | New 1TB NVMe SSD + 2TB HDD

product_name: Dell OptiPlex 7040 SFF Desktop Computer PC Intel Quad Core i7-6700 3.20GHz AX200 Built-in WiFi 6 Bluetooth 16GB DDR4 256GB NVMe M.2 SSD 2TB HDD HDMI Wireless Keyboard & Mouse Windows10 Pro (Renewed)
review_header: Great value and same experience as with a new PC purchase
review_text: So far I am quite satisfied with this item.  This is my first "Amazon Renewed" purchase, or refurbished device of any type.The first boot-up and configuring of the installed Windows-10 went smoothly.  I am not sure if this i7-6700 based system can ever be upgraded to Windows-11, but no worries; with Windows-10, 32 GB of RAM, a 1-TB SSD and a 2-TB HDD, I am now able to run the latest version of my 3D-CAD and video editing programs, and just about anything else I can think of.  I'm presently not into gaming, but there are plenty of graphics cards available if the integrated graphics chipset was not sufficient for some high-end games.This PC came with a new wireless keyboard and mouse.  The mouse was the only thing I had a minor issue with.  When pressing the left mouse button I could sometimes feel a physical interference with the right button.  On close inspection I could see the ends of both button surfaces (between the buttons) not been sufficiently trimmed of casting flash.  This was easily corrected with a razor knife, and now both mouse buttons press smoothly with no interference.Overall, I am very happy with this purchase and would not hesitate recommending STG for anyone looking for a great deal on a powerful general purpose PC.
variant_name: Style: i7-6700 3.40Ghz, Size: 32GB | New 1TB NVMe SSD + 2TB HDD

product_name: RORSOU R10 Over-Ear Headphones with Microphone, Lightweight Folding Stereo Bass Headphones with 1.5M No-Tangle Cord, Portable Wired Headphones for Smartphone Tablet Computer MP3 / 4 (Black)
review_header: Lightweight and Great Sound Quality for the Price!
review_text: The RORSOU R10 On-Ear Headphones have been a pleasant surprise, delivering a good mix of sound quality, comfort, and portability at an affordable price. I‚Äôve used these daily for both work and leisure, and here‚Äôs my detailed take:Key Features I Loved:Sound Quality: The stereo bass is surprisingly rich and clear for a budget pair of headphones. It handles music, podcasts, and even phone calls well without distortion.Lightweight Design: The headphones are incredibly light, making them comfortable to wear for long periods without causing ear fatigue.Portable and Foldable: The folding design is a big plus for anyone on the go. It fits easily in my bag without taking up much space.No-Tangle Cord: The 1.5M cord is a perfect length and, as promised, it doesn‚Äôt tangle easily, which makes it hassle-free to use.Room for Improvement:Build Quality: While the headphones look sleek, the plastic construction feels a bit fragile. I‚Äôd be cautious about dropping or rough handling.Microphone Placement: The microphone works fine, but its placement on the cord sometimes picks up unwanted rubbing noises during calls.Personal Insights:I use these headphones primarily for video calls and casual listening. They‚Äôve performed consistently well and are especially good for quick tasks like plugging into a smartphone or tablet. The bass isn‚Äôt as deep as high-end models, but it‚Äôs more than adequate for this price point.Why I Recommend It:For under $20, these headphones provide excellent value. They‚Äôre perfect for students, commuters, or anyone looking for an affordable, no-frills audio solution. If you treat them gently, they‚Äôre a solid, budget-friendly choice.Summary:The RORSOU R10 On-Ear Headphones are a great option for everyday use, offering good sound quality, comfort, and portability. While the build could be sturdier, their performance and features make them a worthwhile buy for anyone on a budget!

product_name: Philips 22 inch Class Thin Full HD (1920 x 1080) 75Hz Monitor, VESA, HDMI & VGA Port, 4 Year Advance Replacement Warranty, 221V8LN
review_text: I was looking for a good high quality monitor at an affordable price. This was perfect for me. Easy set up and a crisp clean picture.

product_name: Philips 22 inch Class Thin Full HD (1920 x 1080) 75Hz Monitor, VESA, HDMI & VGA Port, 4 Year Advance Replacement Warranty, 221V8LN
review_text: For $80, this monitor is a gem. It won't turn your games into visual masterpieces or hit sky-high refresh rates, but it does what it‚Äôs meant to: deliver a solid 70Hz, decent colors, and a blue light filter so you can scroll emails without frying your eyeballs. The 24" screen offers just enough real estate for multitasking, perfect for work or web surfing with all your toolbars out. The fonts stay crisp, the colors stay readable, and the settings let you tweak things to perfection. No curve‚Äîbecause curves cost cash‚Äîbut at this price? Who‚Äôs complaining?

product_name: RORSOU R10 Over-Ear Headphones with Microphone, Lightweight Folding Stereo Bass Headphones with 1.5M No-Tangle Cord, Portable Wired Headphones for Smartphone Tablet Computer MP3 / 4 (Black)
review_header: Amazing headphones but they have a catch
review_text: Amazing headphones for the price. There is a catch because they only last a few months before the hinge connecting the actual headphone to the plastic piece above normally breaks. We have gotten these headphones 3 times and each time we needed to replace them for the same reason  otherwise if you are just looking for a short term replacement this would work great but if you need one that can last at least a year I would suggest going for another one.

product_name: Etekcity Food Kitchen Scale, Digital Grams and Ounces for Weight Loss, Baking, Cooking, Keto and Meal Prep, LCD Display, Medium, 304 Stainless Steel
review_header: Track Calories and Macros Like a Pro ‚Äì Perfect for Weight Loss & Meal Prep!
review_text: I bought this scale to help with my weight loss journey, and it‚Äôs honestly one of the best tools I‚Äôve added to my kitchen. It doesn‚Äôt just weigh food‚Äîit connects to a free app that tracks calories, macros, and 19 different nutrients. Total game changer.The first time I used it, I was meal-prepping chicken and rice, and I was shocked how easy it was to log everything. You just place the food on the scale, open the app, and it gives you the full breakdown‚Äîno guessing, no Googling.The stainless steel design looks sleek and is super easy to clean. It‚Äôs accurate, quick, and the 11lb limit is perfect for anything from small snacks to full meals. Whether you‚Äôre cutting, bulking, or just trying to eat smarter, this scale makes nutrition tracking way simpler.If you're serious about your health goals and want something that actually helps you stick to them‚Äîthis is the scale to get.

product_name: Stanley Quencher H2.0 Tumbler with Handle and Straw 30 oz | Flowstate 3-Position Lid | Cup Holder Compatible for Travel | Insulated Stainless Steel Cup | BPA-Free | Nectarine
review_text: I love this cup! It's touch, pretty, easy to clean, and I've dropped it a few times with little to no leakage. It's pricey, but for me, I use it all the time to keep my icy drinks chilly, so it's worth it.

product_name: ZINUS 12 Inch Ultima Memory Foam Mattress, Queen, Fiberglass Free, Pressure Relieving, CertiPUR-US Certified, Mattress in A Box, White
review_text: This review is for the 10" Queen version of the ZInus Ultimate Comfort mattress.I chose this particular model for several reasons. First, it is manufactured by Zinus. Now, Zinus does not have the name recognition of Tempur-Pedic, nor the same high-end reputation, or prices. Various Amazon sellers sell at on of assorted Zinus mattresses under a bunch of names, and they mostly get very good reviews. This model, a 10" Queen featuring 3 inches of memorey foam over "2 inches Pressure Relieving Comfort Foam," on top of 5 inches of higher-density base foam, appears to be identical to other brands that receive 4+ star ratings over numerous sales here. Add to this the fact that this particular listing was both shipped by and sold by Amazon, and I felt I couldn't go wrong. And, of course, my innerspring mattress was 15 years old and needed to replaced.I received the mattress only today, and have only slept on it for a few hours, and will update this after a few weeks and maybe later. Prime 2-day shipping didn't fail me, and the 65 lb box was dropped right next to my house by FedEx. I handled the box fine myself but it was a little bigger than expected and without any handles, and a lot of people will definitely need help to move it up any stairs, if not move it all. Neatly packed, nothing extra, no cushioning needed.Some reviews of memory foam mattresses led me to believe they can take 24-48 hours to fully expand from their compressed shipping state. Others caution you to have the mattress at least near where you will ultimately sleep on it before you unwrap it. The second bit of advice is definitely worth mentioning; mine expanded and unfolded rapidly, reaching near-full dimensions in seconds. After wrestling it of the floor (I should have opened the plastic with it on the platform), I measured its height at 9 inches. Two hours later I found it a full 10 inches high. It is also a full 60 x 80, unlike many mattresses on Amazon that are undersized at 58 x 78 inches. That is a big deal to me - I want all of the 80 inch length a proper queen mattress provides, and filling out standard sheets without them being loose or baggy is a must.I have not had a full night's sleep as of this review, but I did take a quick nap, which turned into a very long nap. It is comfortable. This mattress cradles me enough, yet is still firm enough to be supportive. Time will tell, but my initial impressions of this mattress are that it will be great to sleep on, and that it is a real bargain.Update after 3.5 years: I love this mattress! I had concerns about the durability of a $230 mattress, but it is still perfectly comfortable and is holding up well. It is certainly on the firmer side, which was what I had hoped for, though it is soft enough to cushion my 190+ pound self very well. I've noticed none of the problems some reviewers mention: it doesn't "sleep hot," there was no off-gassing or strong smell, and the cover is just fine.I have no regrets about buying this mattress. When considering how much money I saved on it, it's easy to think maybe I should go ahead and replace it since it's been more than worth the price and is a few years old now. But it still shows little wear and looks like it should be fine for several more years. Note that sheets made for taller mattresses are commonly available these days, and sheets designed for a 14" mattress will fit loosely, but that's not this mattress's fault - it's solid (enough).
variant_name: Color: White, Size: Queen, Style: 10 Inch, Pattern Name: Smooth Comfort (Original Box)

product_name: ZINUS 12 Inch Ultima Memory Foam Mattress, Queen, Fiberglass Free, Pressure Relieving, CertiPUR-US Certified, Mattress in A Box, White
review_text: I was hoping for an experience more like my pillows or mattress pad, but thicker, but not so soft that it hurts my back.  This is not it.This mattress is so firm, that I got up and looked at flipping it over - thinking maybe I was sleeping on the wrong side.  From a posture alignment perspective, it is good.  My spine is aligned when I sleep on my side.  I don't have back pain.But, it feels like I am sleeping one of those thin mats on the floor.  The mattress only gives at the pressure points.  I hardly sink in the mattress at all.  And, I am unable to sleep on my stomach.  It is either really uncomfortable or causes back pain.  I've been too exhausted to figure out if I am sleeping on my back.Interestingly, it does not slip.  I have it on a metal platform frame and it seems to be quite firmly in place.I let it expand for 48h before laying on it.  No smell.As a tip, don't open the package to make it easier to drag upstairs.  It expands on the way up and gets quite heavy very fast.My biggest issue with it is that it is so firm.  The softness is only the surface.  If you brush your arms across it, it feels soft.  But, when you lay on it, it's slightly more cushioned than sleeping on the floor.Update:  Two weeks later, the mattress has softened up.  I can now sleep on my side, back,mand stomach without back pain.  I am docking a point because it feels like I am making an indention on a smooth surface and and another star as it does not feel luxuriously comfortable but it does not interfere with my sleep.  I am now buying a topper and a plush pad to add a few inches of softness so that I will hopefully retain back support but add that luxurious feeling.  I guess it is fair to expect that a mattress purchased online will require some adjustment, but I do wonder if it would have been cheaper to have chosen a different one in the first place.If you have purchased this mattress and find it to be too firm or are looking for back support and plan to buy this one, my recommendation is to give it two weeks and to sleep on your side during this adjustment period.  If you still find it to be too firm, options are to return it (yes apparently this can be arranged) or add additional layers.  As one last comment, I bought the 8 inch, so I can add additional layers and still fit within standard fitted sheets.  You may also want to consider this as well when deciding how think you want to go.Update #2 - It has now been a little over two weeks since the mattress arrived.  I became happier with it as it became softer, but wanted a truly 5-Star sleep experience.  So, I purchased the Sleep Master Gel Memory Foam 2 Inch Topper, Queen.  It turns out that this supportive mattress paired with that softt topper was a perfect combination.  Every inch of my body is cradled in a cushion that gives at pressure points and supports my weight there and everywhere else.  I love it!Update #3.  The mattress has grooves where I sleep.  Laying on it causes me back pain.  I figured out that this is due to no lumbar support.  There is a gap between my back and the mattesss when I sleep on my back.  When I lie on my stomach my back caves forward.  The next day, I have to stop and stretch my back.  If I drop something, I pick it up slowly and carefully as my back is stiff and creaky.  To combat this, I am now laying on the other side, but back to sleeping only on my side - as I did originally.  And, now that I have figured out that I can lay on the sofa with no problems, this confirms that the problem is the foam mattress and not me.Update #4.  I ended up with terrible back pain after using this mattress.  By the time I resorted to trying to sleep sideways across the bed or curling up so my spine would realign, I figured out that this was not going to work out.  Fortunately, this was within 30 days, and I was able to return the mattress for a full refund.  But, the reality is, any bed may need some help.  So, I just wanted to share what I have learned.How to Choose a Bed#1. Ignore reviews of anyone who has had a mattress for less than two or three weeks; the mattress is still changing.  New reviewers are just excited about opening up the package and sleeping on a real bed.  You want to know how well the bed sleeps after its break in period.#2 - Go through some of the online wizards and articles on how to choose a bed depending on whether you are a back, side, or stomach sleeper.  Note that you do not have to go very, very firm if you have a bad back.  Back care is all about sping alignment.  Soft and firm cushions are all about preference. I learned that Imlike a plush feel on top of a bed with responsive spine alignment. I sleep on my back, stomach, and side.  And, I want my spine to be aligned even though I have a curvy hips and butt.  I want to have a bed soft enough but firm enough to cushion my breasts without my back feeling like it is caving in.  I started with an innerspring mattress with a plush topper.  The innerspring is responsive so that I am not waiting for it to reinflate when I turn over.  The cushions feel luxurious.#3. Do not buy bargain cheap or top of the line expecting it to be what you need; a bare minimum is that a bed should support and align your spine and beyond that it is all about cushions and toppers - which you layer on yourself - so leave room in the budget for this.#4 - Do not assume that you will like memory foam mattresses.  If you have never tried one, go to the Mattress Firm around the corner and lay on some beds.  But, go in there to learn how the different types of beds feel, particularly the support.  DON'T BUY from them for heavens sake... unless you want to spent $3,000 for a $1,200 mattress.  If you want to go local, I found a mattress that felt like a $1,200 hybrid for $600 after discounts at Sears.How I Fixed Back Pain Due to Body Impressions and Sinking too far in.I tried many things.  In the end, a good end is all about support first and cushion second. If you are sinking in too far or jackknifing or hammocking, then it means that you have inadequate support - those are the hard layers below.  It makes the mattress counteract your weight by pushing up against you and you press down in it.  What I did not get is that all the layers respond, not just the top ones.  So, the support below the mattress is just as important as the cushy layers above.  The job of the top layers above is just to counteract pressure points, so you do not ferl like you are laying on the floor.  The job of the bottom layers and boxspring/foundation, is to keep the mattress feeling firm and to keep it from sagging.  That said, I fixed a sagging mattress, sinking in, and back pain by putting a smooth, hard layer underneath the mattress - no gaps, slats, or holes.  A heavy duty cardboard moving box covered by a blanket is a temporary fix.  Plywood or a good old fashioned box spring are other options. Point is, try this first.

product_name: Maidenform Women's Comfort Devotion Hipster Underwear No Show
review_text: These are by far my favorite undergarments!In most undergarments I wear a small, but it seems that those don't always cover the width of my rear end quite as I'd like them lol, but with these, I don't have that problem at all. They seem to be cut just a little bit wider in the back but by no means are they "granny panties".They are incredibly soft, and because they are made with a stretchy material, the waist band and leg bands are essentially made from the same material, not elastic. I like that because it isn't too tight or pinchy around the legs and waist. I would say basically that I feel like I am not wearing any undergarments when I wear these.I am writing this review a few months after I purchased these- they have held up well in the wash. I was them on regular (not delicate) and they come out just fine. They haven't lost any stretch and there is no piling on them.I don't buy these for the "No VPL" part as I don't worry about that. If I had purchased these for that reason, then I would give 4 out of 5 stars because while they are better than your standard Hanes underwear, you can still see a little panty line on some garments.

review_header: I did NOT expect great sounding ,wired headphones for such low price!
review_text: I live in an apartment w/an elderly couple living below me and I stay up super late so I have always been using headphones at night out of sheer respect.This past year however I've been trying out a few different Blu-tooth ear-buds ,but was always irritated since their typica life-span is about 4 hrs after a single charge & I'd always get 'stuck' without any 'headphone-gear' until my 'Bluetooth Earbuds' were 'good to go' again.I finally said never again.I don't mind wearing a wired pair of headphones.One less thing to charge which is the biggest benefit. Tho' I must admit I didn't expect these headphones to be anything but mediocre for the price ,but boy was I wrong.They sound fantastic. Loud , clear ,comfortable ,etc. I know there are headphones out there which are 10x better but they're also 10x more expensive and these surprised me in a good way.Very nice sounding pair of headphones ,especially for the price & NO MORE CHARGING for me.

product_name: Philips 22 inch Class Thin Full HD (1920 x 1080) 75Hz Monitor, VESA, HDMI & VGA Port, 4 Year Advance Replacement Warranty, 221V8LN
review_header: Philips 24inch Wide-Screen Monitor A Nice Addition
review_text: This Philips monitor works well with my new rebuilt stand-alone CPU. It was recognized quickly by Windows 10, which made its initial setup, and use, very easy. Its color and display quality are very accurate. I would highly recommend this monitor for the price.

product_name: Philips 22 inch Class Thin Full HD (1920 x 1080) 75Hz Monitor, VESA, HDMI & VGA Port, 4 Year Advance Replacement Warranty, 221V8LN
review_text: The good news: it's nice and bright; no complaints there.  But for some reason, the power and interface connections don't face the back; they face downward at the bottom of the monitor, which makes it impossible to see what you're doing when trying to make connections.  For me, real estate considerations made it difficult to tip the monitor on its side, but you pretty much have to.Another gripe: I don't need the monitor for sound output and didn't connect audio to it, but after making the video connection, I was baffled why my normal speakers were suddenly silent.  Finally I thought to check, and sure enough, the sound output device had been changed to the monitor, without notification.  Maybe that's Windows' fault, but I question why the monitor includes a speaker (low quality according to reviews here): doesn't everybody have other ways of making sound?

review_text: This makes washing greens and other veggies and fruit very easy. I do wish it came with instructions, but I watched the video on the Amazon page and it's pretty simple. Put your greens in the basket, lock the lid down, fill to desired water level, spin, drain, and then spin again to dry. Very easy. It has plenty of room to do enough veggies or greens for a family size salad. The drain holes work very well and it doesn't leak all over, so that's good, as I've had that issue with other spinners. It's quite easy to clean. Honestly most of the time I just rinse it and put it in the dish drainer. I like that even though the top can get water inside it because there's two pieces, the water completely drains out when you leave it sitting in the dish drainer. No collection of water to make it smell or mildew.

review_header: Best foodscale for for tracking calories and macros
review_text: I recently purchased this health food scale, and it has completely transformed the way I track my macros and calories! The accuracy is spot on, measuring down to the gram, which makes portioning my meals effortless. It‚Äôs lightweight, sleek, and easy to use, with a clear digital display that takes the guesswork out of weighing food.One of the best features is the tare function, which allows me to zero out the weight of bowls or plates‚Äîperfect for prepping meals without extra math. It also switches seamlessly between units (grams, ounces, milliliters), making it super versatile.Since using this scale, I‚Äôve found it so much easier to hit my daily macro and calorie goals. It eliminates the guesswork, ensuring I stay on track with my nutrition. Whether you‚Äôre counting calories, meal prepping, or following a specific diet plan, this scale is a game-changer. Highly recommend!

product_name: Etekcity Food Kitchen Scale, Digital Grams and Ounces for Weight Loss, Baking, Cooking, Keto and Meal Prep, LCD Display, Medium, 304 Stainless Steel
review_text: Very small scale. Was worried it might be too small.  Got this for accurate measurements for soap making.  It worked perfectly!It's very sensitive and weighs to the nearest gram (this is the unit I used for soaping). Worked perfectly.  Tares easily.  Remembers last tared weight unless you tare again, or turn it off.  Great little compact scale.  Very accurate - I calibrated it with my 100g calibration weight before using.Highly recommend for the price.

product_name: Etekcity Food Kitchen Scale, Digital Grams and Ounces for Weight Loss, Baking, Cooking, Keto and Meal Prep, LCD Display, Medium, 304 Stainless Steel
review_header: Great Product! Even Better Customer Support Team
review_text: I love that my Etekcity Digital Kitchen Scale is a great tool in my kitchen to help me measure food to ensure that I track what I‚Äôm putting into my body, my husband's and my children‚Äôs bodies each and every day, all day! It helps me measure food and ensure the quality control on everything. This food scale is my constant companion. I don‚Äôt eat without it. Now, don‚Äôt get me wrong. I didn't always use a food scale to measure my food intake. In fact, for years when I heard people talk about using a food scale, and measuring their food intake it was always dieters, and one thing I never went on was a diet. At least not in the sense I understood they meant to use the word, "diet"! The thought of depriving my body from food was foreign to me. In fact, growing up with a limited food supply meant that once I was old enough to get a job, I exiled food shortage from my life. However, overeating because food became plentiful in adulthood with a job eventually became a problem. Especially after pregnancy and becoming a mother. An experience worth losing a few vanity points over for sure! However, with weight gain vanity concerns pale in comparison to health concerns. You see, I needed to know for sure that I was eating what my body needed, and that I was feeding my husband and children what their bodies needed. And, if I began to tip over to overeating, I wanted it to be a conscious choice! And for my husband and children, I wanted to help them learn when to recognize that they were tipping over the point of eating the recommended daily calories from each food group so that I and so that they had awareness of when they had enough to do the job of sustaining a thriving body so we could experience the whole life change we were after as a family. This Etekcity Digital Kitchen Scale plays a big part of helping us do that. All day, every day. It makes it easy. It takes just a second to put the food on it and measure the serving size. And I get to choose the units (ounces, grams, etc.).Now, I don't know about you, but I LOVE observing how people who work for companies in a support capacity do their jobs. And when I come across a person or staff that wows me, I stop and take notice! I also stop and take notice when I come across staff that has the opposite effect on me. And my follow through is just as thorough then as this review is now. The Etekcity Digital Kitchen Scale support team wowed me! Immediately they responded to my inquiry when my scale, which I had for a long time, stopped working one day. Like I told you, this thing works hard all day every day measuring food for a family of four. Well, their support team instructed me on how to troubleshoot what was the cause of the problem, offered to send me a new scale, which arrived quickly, AND the piece de resistance. Several weeks later, they reached out to me to ask me how the new scale was working. Talk about a customer support team! Now that's the kind of service I want all day every day!So, if you're considering buying a food scale for yourself and/or your family, I highly recommend the Etekcity Digital Kitchen Scale. Not just because it's an amazing digital piece of machinery, but because the company has people, actual human beings who work there that care about the service they provide customers and it shows in the CRM (customer relationship management) system they very likely automated utilizing the beauty of digital technology to do it, but they also kept the human element present with their service, which gives them an extra edge.This is my third Etekcity Digital Kitchen Scale! It's a machine. It isn't meant to last forever. All machines eventually stop working. There's an expected life for every machine. And when this machine serves me till it can't anymore, like the last 2 did, I'll gratefully whisper a thank you for your service to the people who made it and gladly buy another one. Year after year. Etekcity and their customer team now have a "raving fan", as one of my favorite teachers and mentors calls it! When you get yours, let me know if you become a raving fan of the Etekcity Digital Kitchen Scale too.

review_text: I used to make fun of people for using these Stanley cups, I always thought they were overpriced and over hyped. But I purchased this for my little sister who is in nursing school, and she takes this thing with her everywhere!!! All she does is rave about how amazing it is! So I bought one as well, and they really are amazing products. Made super well, they keep ice in them for hours and hours! Super comfortable to hold in your hand, not too heavy or bulky. product_name: Cuisinart Large Salad Spinner, 5-Qt , Vegetable & Fruit Salad Washing Bowl with Strainer, Quick Prep Spinner for Salad Greens, Lettuce, Fruits & Vegetables, CTG-00-SAS
review_header: Never thought I'd have so much to say about a salad spinner!
review_text: In 2019, I bought a Gourmia salad spinner.  Although it was gray and a different brand, it looked like the one shown here (and different from the one Gourmia now sells).  While it did feel somewhat cheap, it worked great for me for over 2 years before the bowl finally broke after my toddler knocked it to the floor, and I explicitly chose this Cuisinart one because I wanted the same model.  Indeed, upon receiving it, it did appear to be an identical model with a different brand name stamped on the top... however, the new one was very defective.  It had some blackened stuff (maybe charred?) stuck on the nut on the lid, and the translucent plastic disc inside the lid was warped to the point it didn't spin well.I emailed Cuisinart's customer service and they were great... with no fuss, they sent me a replacement model which just arrived today.  However, their replacement model is markedly different.  This listing matches what is on Cuisinart's website, but the replacement matches the one from Bed, Bath, and Beyond (still Cuisinart brand though).  I'm still undecided whether this is good or bad.  They're comparable sizes, although the BB&B version is a little narrower at the bottom, so probably slightly less total volume.  The BB&B bowl also feels slightly sturdier, although I suspect both will still crack pretty easily if dropped.  But the biggest difference is the lids.  The BB&B lid is much heavier with a more complicated mechanism.  It feels much sturdier, but it also feels like more things can break, I'm not sure why anything complex was needed here.  And what I liked most about the original lid is that it has a simple plastic nut which comes off to make the entire lid easily washable... the BB&B version doesn't really come apart and has metal screws in it (although nothing that can touch the food, luckily), so I'll be trying to minimize water exposure there which might make keeping it clean a bit of a challenge.Anyway, bottom line here is this is a cheap salad spinner that can easily break, but that should be expected at this price point.  But it's a good size, light weight, very easy to use, and easier to clean than most alternatives... just make sure when you get it that none of the pieces are warped and that it spins easily.  And if not, at least Cuisinart customer service is very good.

product_name: Stanley Quencher H2.0 Tumbler with Handle and Straw 30 oz | Flowstate 3-Position Lid | Cup Holder Compatible for Travel | Insulated Stainless Steel Cup | BPA-Free | Nectarine
review_text: I ordered the blue 30 oz and got a beautiful dark red 40 oz. Thank you for the upgrade üòÅ I love my Stanley's. I have ordered several and will buy more for gifts. These are well worth the money, the quality is outstanding, I love every color I have gotten and cannot wait to see what colors you come up with next. Only problem I have had is that the classic trigger action ones take forever to be shipped. Otherwise amazing products.

product_name: Dell OptiPlex 7040 SFF Desktop Computer PC Intel Quad Core i7-6700 3.20GHz AX200 Built-in WiFi 6 Bluetooth 16GB DDR4 256GB NVMe M.2 SSD 2TB HDD HDMI Wireless Keyboard & Mouse Windows10 Pro (Renewed)
review_header: Great product but was missing keyboard & mouse dongle/transceiver USB
review_text: The product is great and with no issues. I did not receive the dongle/transceiver for the mouse and keyboard. Therefore, the mouse and keyboard and useless.  I did read a couple of reviews that said the same thing and this tend to be a trend and would request that who ever is packing the product items pay close attend to ensure customers are receiving all items that they paid for.
variant_name: Style: i5-6500 3.20Ghz, Size: 16GB | 256GB NVMe SSD + 2TB HDD

product_name: Dell OptiPlex 7040 SFF Desktop Computer PC Intel Quad Core i7-6700 3.20GHz AX200 Built-in WiFi 6 Bluetooth 16GB DDR4 256GB NVMe M.2 SSD 2TB HDD HDMI Wireless Keyboard & Mouse Windows10 Pro (Renewed)
review_text: Its a nice computer, I like the form factor, built in wifi and bluetooth, and three monitor ports. The big problem is that after hours of struggle I finally found out that the Dell UEFI simply cannot read a Linux boot partition. Yes, I made sure that I was on the latest UEFI/BIOS version and it was only after hours of effort that I learned this from some deep corner of the internet. I guess that might mean not too many are trying this but it is still super annoying and there is zero reason for Dell to do this so I had to knock off a star.
variant_name: Style: i7-6700 3.40Ghz, Size: 32GB | New 1TB NVMe SSD + 2TB HDD

review_text: I didnt even notice when I bought it that it didnt come with card reader. Thats my bad! I just assumed it did until it didn't. Also, the keyboard and mouse that came with didn't work and the unit itself has this funky HDMI port that takes a special adapter that sticks out about three inches and is very delicate. If it moves at all your screen will go blank

product_name: Maidenform Women's Comfort Devotion Hipster Underwear No Show
review_header: These are my favorite! I keep ordering more...
review_text: I'm 5'8" and about 125 pounds, I wear a size 2 in jeans give or take, and I usually prefer medium underwear because I really hate it when the leg openings are too tight. After reading reviews I ordered the 5 (small) in these. They are perfect! The fit is great. The leg openings and waist are all the right size. I'd say the rise is on the low end of medium. (For some reason I usually have a hard time finding undies with a low enough rise that aren't also too small in other places.) They don't chafe or ride up and the middle is the perfect width, wide enough for a party liner. The fabric is smooth with some stretch, it conforms to your shape but doesn't get stretched out.Whenever I need to get over $35 to get free shipping, I throw another pair of these in my cart. :P
variant_name: Size: 5, Color: Hipster - Black W/Body Beige Lining, Number of Items: 1

product_name: Maidenform Women's Comfort Devotion Hipster Underwear No Show
review_text: I love these panties - I've been wearing the first pairs I bought for 2 years now, and finally coming back to replace them. No panty lines, and super comfortable and breathable! I like the nude colored ones, which hide well under white pants. They did stretch out after a while, but not to the point where I couldn't wear them. The crotch lining also started to fall apart a bit after a while, but not too bad. Will definitely keep buying!

product_name: Philips 22 inch Class Thin Full HD (1920 x 1080) 75Hz Monitor, VESA, HDMI & VGA Port, 4 Year Advance Replacement Warranty, 221V8LN
review_text: My only complaint is that it is not very adjustable. You can turn the screen from side to side, but you cannot adjust the height or tilt the screen forward or back. Or at least not so that this simpleton could figure it out. (I saw another review that listed "tiltable" as a pro (vs con) to this product. I wish I could write that reviewer and ask how.) I feel like the screen tilts forward a bit and I wish I could tilt it back. It is subtle, so it didn't show well in pictures, so I didn't bother adding one to this review. However, that being said, it is otherwise a decent product, easy enough to set up and plug in, and I found the image quality to be fine. And to be honest it is better quality than I expected for the price. I got it for $70 and a lot of the other monitors I was looking at online cost a lot more.

review_text: Works really well but I have had two cracked bowls they are not strong enough. The customer service has been great they shipped me a new replacement bowl within the first few months.

product_name: Etekcity Food Kitchen Scale, Digital Grams and Ounces for Weight Loss, Baking, Cooking, Keto and Meal Prep, LCD Display, Medium, 304 Stainless Steel
review_header: Super product that is super useful
review_text: I've had the stainless steel model for over two years and have never had a problem with it or needed to change batteries. It has been incredibly useful. Just today, I needed half a box of powdered sugar. No need to pour some sugar out, look down inside the box and try to eyeball it. Just put a bowl on the scale and turn it on. It automatically sets to zero when turned on, no matter what is on it. Pour powdered sugar into the bowl until the readout says 8oz and you have half of a 16oz box. So easy and it is also nice to be able to confirm that the box holds the weight it should. C&H Sugar passes the test. I had taken 8oz out before and there was exactly 8oz left. Kudos to C&H. The units on the scale are very convenient and easy to select. It's easy to weigh things without making a mess, but if you do, the stainless steel surface is very easy to clean. My mother used a clunky spring-loaded scale that I hated. Thanks to modern technology, weighing grams, ozs, and lbs in the kitchen is a breeze. I have also used it for weighing letters before mailing. I couldn't be happier with this Etekcity product.

product_name: Stanley Quencher H2.0 Tumbler with Handle and Straw 30 oz | Flowstate 3-Position Lid | Cup Holder Compatible for Travel | Insulated Stainless Steel Cup | BPA-Free | Nectarine
review_header: It holds its temperature VERRY well
review_text: It holds its temperature VERRY well, a little bit too well, if you fill it up with ice and put a fridge chilled drink into so your sodas, and your juices it will turn almost so a slushy. Sometimes the lid is hard to take off but if you kinda gently bang the lid on the counter or something it will usually make it a little easier to take off the lid. I use this while I'm trucking and the size is great for sitting in the cup holder.It's a nice simple look on it. Adequate liquid flow in the straw so you don't have to suck on the straw hard at all. It is nice to hold in your hand. I put my cup and straw into the dishwasher and it cleans pretty good but maybe clean the straw separately so the soapy taste doesn't stay for long. When I use this cup, I stay hydrated pretty easily and can measure how much liquid I drink a day

product_name: Etekcity Food Kitchen Scale, Digital Grams and Ounces for Weight Loss, Baking, Cooking, Keto and Meal Prep, LCD Display, Medium, 304 Stainless Steel
review_text: I am enjoying this scale. It isn‚Äôt totally accurate, as the same thing can be said to be a gram or so different within a few minutes. But the differences are not at all worrisome. If you are worried about a gram either way, this isn‚Äôt the right sort of scale for you. For cooking, though, this is wonderful. I have used it particularly to weigh the various things I put in my morning cereal bowl, so that the concoction is more or less the same every morning and is reasonably in line with what the box says is one serving. Since my cereal bowls are large, it is all too easy to pour far too much into the bowl if you don‚Äôt weigh or measure the ingredients.Beyond simple weighing, probably the most useful feature for me is the Zero button. You can put an empty bowl on the scale, zero it out, and then easily get the weight of what you put into the bowl. The scale ignores the weight of the bowl itself. As you put the ingredients into the bowl, you can zero it out after each one, to get the weight of each ingredient separately, without any arithmetic. This feature is especially welcome first thing in the morning, when I am too sleepy to do the most elementary calculations correctly.It is also helpful to be able to weigh portions as you divide up meat or something else, such as a big bowl of salad, into single servings. Since I live alone and often need to do this, something to allow me to make the servings equal is invaluable.Of course, the scale is also useful for non-cooking tasks, when you need to know the weight of something small. For instance, are you sure that envelope you are putting in the mail is really under an ounce? Put it on the scale to be sure how much postage you need. (Changing from one unit of measurement to another is just a matter of touching a button, in this case perhaps several times, as the function circles through the various measures available, rather than jumping directly to the one you want.)Turning on or off is a matter of touching a button (no need to press; just touch). Operation is quick - most functions are virtually instantaneous.  The exception is that the unit ‚Äúthinks‚Äù a bit when weighing. The weight changes a little over a few seconds, so waiting until it stabilizes instead of taking the first weight displayed is a good idea, if you are looking for an accurate result. The change isn‚Äôt large, however, so if getting the most accurate possible weight is not important to you, there is no strong reason not to take the first displayed weight. Just know that what displays in the first second is probably slightly off.Charging, which I did need to do after a few months, is much quicker than I expected.. I put it on the charger, thinking that it would take hours, but it charged in much less. I didn‚Äôt note the exact time, so I can‚Äôt say just how long it took, but I remember being quite surprised at how fast it was.Overall, I am more than pleased. I hope the unit continues to function so well.

product_name: Etekcity Food Kitchen Scale, Digital Grams and Ounces for Weight Loss, Baking, Cooking, Keto and Meal Prep, LCD Display, Medium, 304 Stainless Steel
review_text: We use this daily. It has all the different weights (ounces, grams, pounds and liters. Just press the power button and you can switch to zero without having to move what you are weighing. I love that. Really comes in handy when you‚Äôre counting your macros. Great price. We leave ours on the counter but it‚Äôs small enough to store in a drawer.
